sen.j: 木幡駅（こはたえき）は、京都府宇治市にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Uji City of Kyoｔo Prefecture, Kohata Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Kohata Station, located in Uji City of Kyoｔo Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Kohata Station, located in Uji City of Kyoｔo Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: JRの駅名は「こはた」だが、京阪宇治線の木幡駅 (京阪)は「こわた」と、それぞれ読み方が異なる。
sen.e: This JR station is named 'Kohata,' but the station on Keihan Uji Line using identical (Chinese) characters is read/pronounced differently and is 'Kowata Station.'
sen.cmt: ご指示に反しますが、漢字が解らない読者が理解できるよう、原文を多少敷衍しました。
sen.e: This JR station is named 'Kohata,' but the station on Keihan Uji Line using identical (Chinese) characters is read/pronounced differently and is 'Kowata Station.'
This JR station is named 'Kohata,' but the station on Keihan Uji Line using identical (Chinese) characters is read/pronounced differently and is 'Kowata' Station.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 単式・島式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ行違い可能な地上駅。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with one one-sided platform (track on one side only) and another of Island type between two tracks (one the aforesaid track) adjacent to it enabling trainｓ to pass each other/otheｒｓ.

It is an aboveground station with a one-sided platform (track on one side only) and another of the island type between two tracks (one being the aforesaid track) adjacent to it, enabling trainｓ to pass each other/otheｒｓ.
It is an aboveground station with a one-sided platform (track on one side only) and another of the island type with one track, enabling trainｓ to pass each other or otheｒs.

sen.j: 以前は2面3線であったが、中線は撤去されている。
sen.e: It was formerly a station with two platforms and three tracks, but the track or rails in the the middle have been dismantled.
It was formerly a station with two platforms and three tracks, but the track or rails in the middle have been dismantled.
It was formerly a station with two platforms and three tracks, but the track or rails in the middle have been dismantled.

sen.j: なお駅業務はジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: Station operations have been commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations have been commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations have been commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅であり、ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: ICOCA Cards and J Through Cards can be used as well as PiTaPa Cards (Surutto Kansai Association) which are subject to mutual use with ICOCA Cards.
The ICOCA and J Through cards can be used as well as PiTaPa cards (Surutto Kansai Association), which are subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards.
The ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used as well as PiTaPa cards (Surutto KANSAI Association), which are subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 本数的には、京都方面、奈良方面とも、駅本屋側の単式ホーム（1番線）に発着することが多い。
sen.e: More trains to/from both Kyoto and Nara use the single tracked platform (Track #1) nearer station's main structure.
More trains to/from both Kyoto and Nara use the single-track platform (track No. 1) nearer to the station's main structure.
More trains to both Kyoto and Nara use the single-track platform (Platform 1) nearer to the station's main structure.

sen.j: 跨線橋を渡った反対側の島式ホーム側（2番線）は、快速の通過退避をする普通列車が停車する。
sen.e: The opposite Island type platform (Track #2) crossing an overpass is where local trains stop to take refuge allowing rapid trains to overtake.
The opposite island-type platform (track No. 2) crossing an overpass is where local trains stop to take refuge, thus allowing rapid trains to overtake them.
The opposite island-type platform (Platform 2) crossing an overpass is where local trains stop to take refuge, thus allowing rapid trains to overtake them.

sen.j: 駅内配線は、黄檗駅とは違い奈良線みやこ路快速の登場後に1番線による一線スルーに変更され、通過列車は減速をせずに通過が可能になった。
sen.e: Following the introduction of Miyakoji rapid trains on the Nara Line, Track #1within the station yard has been converted to a thoroughfare unlike Obaku Station on which nonstop trains can overtake without slowing down.

Following the introduction of Miyakoji rapid trains on the Nara Line, track No. 1 within the station yard has been converted to a thoroughfare unlike Obaku Station, on which nonstop trains can overtake without slowing down.

Following the introduction of Miyakoji Rapid Service on the Nara Line, track No. 1 within the station yard has been converted to a thoroughfare (unlike Obaku Station), on which nonstop trains can overtake without slowing down.

sen.j: 開業時からの小さな木造駅舎が大事に使われている。
sen.e: The small wooden station building which stood at time of inauguration is still being used with care.
The small wooden station building that stood at the time of inauguration is still being used with care.
The small wooden station building that stood at the time of inauguration is still being used with care.

sen.j: 駅前の郵便ポストは円筒型の、通称&quot丸ポスト&quotである。
sen.e: The barrel type mailbox standing in front of the station is commonly known as 'Maru-post' Mailbox.
The barrel-type mailbox standing in front of the station is commonly known as the 'Maru-post' mailbox.
The barrel-type mailbox standing in front of the station is commonly known as the 'Maru-post' mailbox.

sen.j: 前述したが、快速列車の通過退避を行う普通列車は上下線とも2番線に入る。
sen.e: As already mentioned, both inbound and outbound local trains taking refuge to allow rapid trains to pass come in on Track #2.
As already mentioned, both inbound and outbound local trains taking refuge so as to allow rapid trains to pass come in on track No. 2.
As already mentioned, both inbound and outbound local trains taking refuge so as to allow rapid trains to pass come in on Platform 2.

sen.j: 普通列車同士の行違いの場合は上り列車が1番線、下り列車が2番線に入る。
sen.e: When local trains cross each other for opposite directions, the inbound train comes in on Track #1 and outbound train on Track #2.
When local trains cross each other heading in opposite directions, the inbound train comes in on track No. 1 and the outbound train leaves on track No. 2.
When local trains cross each other heading in opposite directions, the inbound train comes in on Platform 1 and the outbound train leaves on Platform 2.

sen.j: それ以外の列車は上下線とも1番線に入る。
sen.e: Trains other than the above-mentioned whether inbound or outbound come in on Track #1.
Trains other than the above-mentioned, whether inbound or outbound, come in on track No. 1.
Trains other than the above-mentioned, whether inbound or outbound, come in on Platform 1.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約2,685人である。
sen.e: The number of passengers who got on at this station in fiscal 2006 was approximately 2,685 per day.
sen.cmt: “約”は“平均”であるべきかと思われます。
sen.e: The number of passengers who got on at this station in fiscal 2006 amounted to approximately 2,685 per day.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 2,685 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.e: Kohata-jinja Shrine/Kohata-jinja Shrine of Kohata
Kohata-jinja Shrine/Kohata-jinja Shrine of Kohata

sen.j: 宇治木幡郵便局
sen.e: Uji-Kowata Post Office
Uji-Kowata Post Office

sen.j: 京都府立東宇治高等学校 -- タレントの安田美沙子の出身校として知られる。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Higashi-Uji Senior High School…Known as the alma mater of the Japanese talent named Misako YASUDA.
Kyoto Prefectural Higashi-Uji Senior High School…Known as the alma mater of the Japanese talent Misako YASUDA.
Kyoto Prefectural Higashi-Uji Senior High School -- Known as the alma mater of the Japanese talent Misako YASUDA

sen.j: 木幡緑道 -- 歴史の項目参照。
sen.e: Kohata Pedestrian Path -- refer to History paragraph hereunder.
Kohata Pedestrian Path -- refer to the "History" paragraph below.
Kohata Pedestrian Path -- Refer to the History paragraph below.

sen.j: 株式会社京都アニメーション -- 駅前に本社。
sen.e: Kyoto Animation -- Head Office located in front of this station.
Kyoto Animation -- Head office located in front of the station.
Kyoto Animation -- Head office located in front of the station

sen.j: 木幡駅 (京阪)（京阪宇治線） -- 西に徒歩5分ほど。
sen.e: Kohata Station (Keihan) (Keihan Uji Line) -- Some 5 min. on foot to the west.
Kohata Station (Keihan) (Keihan Uji Line) -- A walk of about five minutes to the west
Kowata Station (Keihan) (Keihan Uji Line) -- A walk of about five minutes to the west

sen.e: Kyoto Medical Juvenile Training School
Kyoto Medical Juvenile Training School

sen.j: 京都府道7号京都宇治線
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Highway Route No.7 Uji Road
Kyoto Prefectural Highway Route No.7, Uji Road
Uji Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 7

sen.j: その他、周辺は住宅密集地である。
sen.e: Environs are clustered with dwelling houses.
The environs are clustered with dwelling houses.
The environs are clustered with dwelling houses.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）1月25日 - 奈良鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated as a Nara Railway station on Jan. 25, 1896.
It was inaugurated as a station of the Nara Railway on Jan. 25, 1896.
January 25, 1896: The station was inaugurated as a station of the Nara Railway.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 - 合併により関西鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kansei Railway station on Feb. 7, 1905 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Kansei Railway station on Feb. 7, 1905 as a result of the amalgamation.
February 7, 1905: The station became a Kansai Railway Company station as a result of the amalgamation.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: Kansei Railway nationalized on October 1, 1907 underthe Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: “完成鉄道が鉄道国有化法”では文章が未完。
sen.e: Kansei Railway was nationalized on October 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
October 1, 1907: Kansai Railway Company was nationalized under the Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道木幡駅に。
sen.e: Became Japanese National Railways Kohata Station.
It became Japanese National Railways Kohata Station.
It became Japan National Railways Kohata Station.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 due to split privatization of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: 上記"Japanese" から "JAPAN"への変遷は？
sen.e: It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 due to split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 戦前から戦後にかけ、木幡西部に位置した大日本帝国陸軍宇治火薬製造所木幡分工場への引込線が本駅から引かれていた。
sen.e: A spur line existed from pre-WWII to post-WWII days between this station and Uji Branch Plant of the defunct Imperial Japanese Army Uji Powder Plant located in the western part of Kohata.
sen.cmt: 大日本帝国陸軍の前に"旧"または"当時の"を付けた方が良いと思われましたので。
sen.e: A spur line existed from the pre-WWII to post-WWII days between this station and the Uji branch plant of the defunct Imperial Japanese Army Uji powder plant, located in the western part of Kohata.
A spur line existed from the pre-WWII to post-WWII days between this station and the Kohata branch plant of the defunct Imperial Japanese Army Uji powder plant, located in the western part of Kohata.

sen.j: その後線路は撤去されたものの、築堤の大部分や、道路を跨ぐ橋桁等がそのまま残されており、京阪宇治線以西は道路化されてパナソニック工場や下水処理場へのトラック走行路となっている。
sen.e: Although the track has been removed thereafter, a large part of embankments, bridge girders of road overpasses, etc. still remain and land west of Keihan Uji Line is now a road on which trucks are constantly on the run to and from the Panasonic Plant and a sewage treatment plant.

Although the track was thereafter removed, a large part of the embankments, bridge girders of road overpasses, etc., still remains, and the land west of Keihan Uji Line is now a road on which trucks are constantly running to and from the Panasonic plant and a sewage treatment plant.

Although the track was subsequently removed, many of the embankments, bridge girders of road overpasses, etc., still remain, and the land west of Keihan Uji Line is now a road on which trucks are constantly running to and from the Panasonic plant and a sewage-treatment plant.

sen.j: また本線と並行する一部区間は1983年に遊歩道「木幡緑道」として整備されている。
sen.e: Some sections of the land along the Main Line were converted into a promenade in 1983 and named 'Kohata Pedestrian Path.'
Some sections of the land along the main line were converted into a promenade in 1983 and given the name 'Kohata Pedestrian Path.'
Some sections of the land along the main line were converted into a promenade in 1983 and given the name 'Kohata Pedestrian Path.'
